entities_extracted.text_preview:
agent memory often differ substantially in their motivations, implementations, assumptions, and
evaluation protocols, while the proliferation of loosely defined memory terminologies has further
obscured conceptual clarity. Traditional taxonomies such as long/short-term memory have proven
insufficient to capture the diversity and dynamics of contemporary agent memory systems. This
survey aims to provide an up-to-date and comprehensive landscape of current agent memory research.
We begin by clearl...

nodes.description: A research area focused on how autonomous agents store, retrieve, and utilize information during decision-making and interaction
Traditional cognitive-inspired memory classification, often applied to agent systems but insufficient for modern complexities
Memory mechanisms inherent or emergent in large language models, distinct from explicit agent memory architectures
Technique that enhances language model outputs by retrieving external knowledge at inference time
Practice of structuring input prompts or contexts to influence model behavior without modifying internal parameters
Agent memory realization where stored information is represented directly in the token sequence, often via prompt augmentation
Agent memory realization based on learned model parameters, typically updated through fine-tuning or meta-learning
Agent memory realization that stores information in latent vector spaces, often using external memory modules or embeddings
The interdisciplinary field studying memory systems in intelligent agents, including their design, function, and evaluation

properties.context: Traditional taxonomies obscure clarity due to oversimplification of modern systems
Research aims to map and clarify the landscape of agent memory
Distinguished as separate but related concepts in the survey
RAG is a related but distinct approach to augmenting model knowledge
Context engineering influences behavior similarly but is not considered true memory
One of three dominant realizations (forms) of agent memory
One of three dominant realizations (forms) of agent memory
One of three dominant realizations (forms) of agent memory
